text:
I don't know if there is a single line limit for java properties, in a 
scenario I'm facing, it would be nice (from readability perspective if nothing 
else) to have the String Contatination functionality support property value 
line wrapping.  For example:
foo=bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb\
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa\
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa\
rrrrrrrrrr\
creator: jwilmoth@starbucks.com

text:
Exactly that works. (Without the trailing backslash).

build.xml
---------
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?>
<project name="test" basedir="." default="main">
    <target name="main">
        <property file="build.properties"/>
        <echo>${foo}</echo>
    </target>
</project>

build.properties
----------------
foo=bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb\
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa\
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa\
rrrrrrrrrr

output
------
Buildfile: build.xml

main:
     [echo] 
bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
arrrrrrrrrr

BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 0 seconds
creator: jan@materne.de
jan@materne.de
text:
p.s.

Ant uses standard java properties and they implement this behaviour.
